name: Holiday Inn Express

reviews.text: It is important to note that this Hoiday Inn Express is a couple thousand feet from a Holiday Inn. They are two very different hotels.
reviews.title: Very good Holiday Inn Express

likes.liked: — Clean, comfortable beds, nice styling, friendly staff, pool, microwave, fridge, large TV

reviews.text: Some Holiday Inn Express hotels are good, some aren't. This one is very good. The lobby is a stark European style. (see photo).
reviews.title: Great Choice

reviews.text: Every room has a fridge and microwave. There is a pool, high speed internet, and the charming downtown section of Fishkill is right nearby. Try the Thai restaurant.
reviews.title: New hotel but horrible stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like other HIE's you get a whole bunch of soft and firm pillows.
reviews.title: Brand new hotel, convenient, simple, comfortable

likes.disliked: — Small non lap swim compatible pool

reviews.text: This hotel is a home away from home, clean new fresh look from the outside in. Checking in was a breeze and the whole time I was there the entire staff caalled me by name. The rooms are very comfortable with king size beds and extra pillows already in the room, I felt like I was in a fancy NYC/ Miami style boutique hotel. The staff is very professional and helpful, especially Nancy and Sarah who really made my stay feel as if i had never left home. the only area i was a little disapointed with was the bathrooms just a little small, but then at 6ft 4" tall when are they not. too many amenities to list but the free laundry was a refreshing change. I would highly recomend staying here if you find yourself in Fishkill NY or are passing by and need a rest break.
reviews.title: Felt like I was at home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: loved the hotel, beautiful for the price! only problem is that they did NOT tell us the rooms where all Non Smoking. they accepted our payment with OUT LETTING US KNOW. very disappointed in the lack of information they gave us.
reviews.title: be aware

reviews.text: I stayed at this Holiday Inn Express the last night of a four night driving trip from Texas to New England. After staying previous nights in Fairfield Inns & Four Points Sheratons that were all outstanding, I have to say that this property beat them all in quality of accommodations and the included breakfast.
reviews.title: Upscale rooms that won't break the bank

reviews.text: The third floor king room was decorated in a very modern style, complete with a huge LCD TV and A+ comfortable bed. The wired and wireless internet were both fast. The bathroom had great, thick towels (better than any place I've stayed) and a good setup. Overall no complaints about the room.
reviews.title: A very comfortable stay

reviews.text: The free breakfast was quite expansive and included eggs, sausage, biscuits, gravy, amazing cinnamon rolls, cereals, bagels, yogurt, fruit, and more. The coffee was good. Front desk staff were efficient although not especially friendly. I liked that you get a bottle of water upon check-in if you're a Priority Club member.
reviews.title: AMAZING!!

reviews.text: I was very surprised when I walked into the lobby of this hotel - lots of shiny white and black decor, mirrors and glass - very chic! The breakfast area is just to the left as ou come in, furnished with funky black chairs and tables. In the seating area to the right, I noticed an unassembled puzzle with large clear plastic pieces placed invitingly on the coffee table. Walking to the elevator, I saw the indoor pool and whirlpool, furnished with bright red chairs.
reviews.title: Upscale look for low price!

reviews.text: The room itself was beautiful with black furnishings, a fridge and microwave, and the largest flatscreen TV I've yet seen in my hotel stays. The bed was tall and comfortable, with clean white linens and comforter, and a spare blanket draped across the foot.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: The location was close to a number of restaurants, gas stations, and shopping, and was easily accessible from I-84. My AAA rate was $114 - a very nice hotel for the money!
reviews.title: Best nights sleep I've had in months....

reviews.text: Pros - Clean Rooms with Modern Style and Comfy Beds
reviews.title: Excellent, Efficient
The Worst Stay ever !! The management group is horrible

reviews.text: Pros - new hotel, extremely friendly staff, huge flat screen tv, lots of accessible electric plugs, good bathroom lighting, mircowave and frig in room, decent workout room, right off freeway, near restaurants and shopping.
reviews.title: VERY NICE - NEW HOTEL

reviews.text: Cons - (only little things) - did not have enough morning newspapers for all guests, no towels or hand sanitizer in workout room, could not turn down music in workout room, not the best room soundproofing - I could hear other guests but maybe because the heater was so quiet.
reviews.title: New hotel great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lost our power in a big storm and needed a place to stay. Called hotel direct and they gave me a special rate due to the storm which was nice as most hotels raise rates when this occurs. Hotel has small but nice rooms. The hotel is brand new so everything is nice. Has a sma.ll indoor pool and offers free breakfast
reviews.title: LOVE IT !!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: This hotel is my home away from home. I stay here often and have never ever had an issue. Decent rates,clean rooms,great FREE breakfast,great location, free local and long distance calls !! where else can you find all that ?? I've stayed at a few of the other local hotels and they simply do not compare ! their staff is amazing - management is just awesome ! Especially the AGM Nancy SulLivan ! Best Hotel in the Hudson Valley by far.
reviews.title: Managememt - Not Nice!!!

likes.disliked: — The treatment by the hotel management

reviews.text: I frequently visit the mid-hudson valley and stay at the local hotels. I chose this hotel because I am a priority club member and thought that special considerations are made to members. .
reviews.title: GREAT stay for the price

description: Welcome to the Holiday Inn Express in Fishkill, New York.If you're traveling on business, our hotel in Fishkill, NY, is convenient to IBM East, the Xerox training center and LAM Research and is just 15 miles from the Culinary Institute of America. If you're traveling by air, our Hudson Valley hotel is close to Stewart International airport (SWF). Albany, LaGuardia and JFK airports are also all within 75 miles of our hotel. For leisure travelers exploring the region's wineries or the Hudson River Art Trail, we make it easy to get around since we're off I-84 and convenient to both Rte. 9 and NYS 52/82. Our Fishkill lodging is a great place to stay when visiting nearby West Point Military Academy or Washington's headquarters at Newburgh. While you sample the many offerings of the Hudson Valley, let our Fishkill accommodations be your home away from home. This new hotel is 100% smoke-free and features high-speed, wireless Internet access in all rooms. Enjoy the heated pool and solarium to relax and rejuvenate after a day spent touring or hiking. Our Fishkill hotel is filled with amenities that make us a wonderful value. The Holiday Inn Express in Fishkill will make your stay as memorable as the area.Take a virtual tour of the hotel.
